parts.text: {"word":"emerge","priority":"★★★","meanings":[{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vi","definition":"現れる、出現する、出てくる","english_definition":"to come out of something or from somewhere","examples":[{"sentence":"The sun emerged from behind the clouds.","translation":"太陽が雲の陰から現れた。"},{"sentence":"New evidence emerged during the investigation.","translation":"捜査中に新たな証拠が現れた。"},{"sentence":"She emerged from the building looking tired.","translation":"彼女は疲れた様子で建物から出てきた。"}],"collocations":["emerge from (～から現れる)","emerge as (～として台頭する)","emerge victorious (勝利を収めて現れる)","emerge unscathed (無傷で現れる)"],"synonyms":["appear","arise","surface","materialize","issue","spring up"],"antonyms":["disappear","vanish","recede","sink"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vi","definition":"(事実などが)明らかになる、判明する","english_definition":""(of facts, ideas, etc.) to become known or apparent","examples":[{"sentence":"It emerged that he had been lying all along.","translation":"彼がずっと嘘をついていたことが明らかになった。"},{"sentence":"The truth will emerge eventually.","translation":"真実は最終的には明らかになるだろう。"},{"sentence":"Details of the plan are beginning to emerge.","translation":"計画の詳細が明らかになり始めている。"}],"collocations":["emerge that (～ということが明らかになる)","emerge as a result (結果として明らかになる)"],"synonyms":["become known","transpire","unfold","surface","come to light","prove to be"],"antonyms":["remain hidden","stay obscure"]},{"part_of_speech":"verb","transitivity":"vi","definition":"(困難などを乗り越えて)台頭する、頭角を現す","english_definition":"to become important, prominent, or successful","examples":[{"sentence":"She emerged as a leading figure in the movement.","translation":"彼女はその運動の指導者として台頭した。"},{"sentence":"The company has emerged as a major player in the industry.","translation":"その会社は業界の主要なプレーヤーとして台頭してきた。"},{"sentence":"He emerged from the crisis stronger than before.","translation":"彼は危機を乗り越え、以前よりも強くなって頭角を現した。"}],"collocations":["emerge as a leader (リーダーとして台頭する)","emerge as a winner (勝者として現れる)","emerge as a key figure (主要人物として台頭する)"],"synonyms":["rise","ascend","develop","evolve","flourish","prosper"],"antonyms":["decline","fade","wither","diminish"]}],"etymology":{"value":"ラテン語の「emergere」（浮かび上がる、現れる）に由来。ex-（外へ）+ mergere（浸す、沈める）から構成される。もともとは水面から出てくるイメージ。","priority":"★★☆"},"pronunciation":{"ipa":"/ɪˈmɜːrdʒ/","syllables":"e-merge"},"inflection":{"verb_forms":{"present_simple":["emerge","emerges"],"past_simple":"emerged","past_participle":"emerged","present_participle":"emerging"}},"usage_notes":{"explanation":"「**emerge**」は、何かの中から出てくる、現れるという意味を持つ動詞です。物理的な出現だけでなく、事実や情報が明らかになる、困難を乗り越えて頭角を現すといった抽象的な意味でも使われます。類義語の「appear」よりも、隠れていたものや潜在的なものが徐々に姿を現すニュアンスが強いです。また、「emerge from」のように前置詞を伴って、出現の場所や原因を示すことが多いです。","priority":"★★★"},"common_mistakes":{"examples":[{"incorrect":"✗ The sun appeared from behind the clouds suddenly.","correct":"✓ The sun emerged from behind the clouds.","note":"「emerge」は徐々に現れるニュアンスが強いので、「suddenly」のような副詞とは相性が悪い場合があります。"},{"incorrect":"✗ The truth emerged to be that he was guilty.","correct":"✓ The truth emerged that he was guilty.","note":"「emerge that」の構文では、「to be」は不要です。"},{"incorrect":"✗ She emerged as a leader very fastly.","correct":"✓ She emerged as a leader very quickly.","note":"副詞は「fastly」ではなく「quickly」を使います。"}],"priority":"★★☆"},"related_words":{"derivatives":["emergence (名詞: 出現、発生)","emergent (形容詞: 出現しつつある、緊急の)"],"phrasal_verbs":["emerge from (～から現れる)"],"priority":"★★★"},"level_frequency":{"CEFR":"B2","frequency_google_ngram":"比較的高頻度 (Relatively high frequency)","priority":"★☆☆"},"readability_explanation":{"level":"B2","text":"「**emerge**」は「現れる」「出現する」という意味で、少しフォーマルな単語です。物理的に何かが出てくるだけでなく、情報や事実が明らかになる、困難を乗り越えて成功するといった意味でも使われます。例えば、「The sun emerged from behind the clouds.（太陽が雲の陰から現れた）」や「New leaders emerged after the revolution.（革命後、新しい指導者たちが現れた）」のように使います。類義語の「appear」よりも、隠れていたものが徐々に姿を現すニュアンスが強いことを覚えておきましょう。"},"example_sentences":[{"sentence":"The submarine **emerged** from the depths of the ocean.","translation":"潜水艦が海の深みから現れた。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"現れる"},{"sentence":"Details of the agreement are beginning to **emerge**.","translation":"合意の詳細が明らかになり始めている。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"明らかになる"},{"sentence":"She **emerged** as the frontrunner in the election.","translation":"彼女は選挙で最有力候補として台頭した。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"台頭する"},{"sentence":"A solution to the problem **emerged** after weeks of discussion.","translation":"数週間の議論の後、問題の解決策が現れた。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"現れる"},{"sentence":"The company **emerged** from bankruptcy stronger than ever.","translation":"その会社は倒産から立ち直り、以前にも増して強くなった。","type":"verb","meaning_category":"台頭する"}]}
